CatDescriptText: Mrs. Juanita Lee, department store employe, 921 Bell Avenue, Carnegie, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" Answer reads: "Where my son and daughter attended high school, at Langley, they received proper counseling.  The counselors saw that my daughter, who has just completed her first year in college, received proper guidance, and as a result, upon graduation from high school was one of three students to receive partial scholarships from the PTA."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Juanita Lee wearing paisley dress, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
